Package rendering.cursor

Class CursorRenderer

java.lang.Object
rendering.cursor.CursorRenderer
public class CursorRenderer
extends java.lang.Object
Controls rendering the cursor which appears in the code window. As far as rendering is concerned a cursor consists of a position where the top of the cursor should be rendered and a boolean which indicates whether or not the cursor is currently being rendered. A cursor should not be rendered if the code window is not currently selected or if it is currently hidden in the flash effect which increases visibility.

  • Constructor Details

    • CursorRenderer

      public CursorRenderer()
      Initializes for Cursor rendering. Creates the shader program, loads the model to the GPU, and loads the color to the shader program. TODO: If text color can be changed the cursor color needs to change too

  • Method Details

    • render

      public void render​(CursorController cursorController, org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector2f codeWindowTranslation)
      Renders the cursor which is contained within the CursorController. It will be visible if the code window is selected, the code window is visible, and the cursor is currently in the visible part of the flashing animation.
      Parameters:
      cursorController - the cursor controller which contains the cursor to be rendered.

    • renderGUIElements

      public void renderGUIElements​(java.util.List<GUIElement> guiElementList)

    • cleanUp

      public void cleanUp()
      Cleans up the memory of the cursor shader. The cursor shader has a GPU program used to render saved inside of GRAM. This will not be automatically cleaned up by the Java garbage collector so it must be deleted manually when this renderer will no longer be used. Called automatically when the program is closed.

    • prepare

      private void prepare()
      Sets the OpenGL state to be appropriate for rendering the cursor.

    • endRendering

      private void endRendering()
      Restores the OpenGL state for another renderer to be called.
